Line 299: Line 299:
==Athletics==
==Athletics==
  +
[[Image:Loyola Wolfpack.jpg|thumb|right|Loyola Wolfpack Logo]]
Loyola's sports teams are nicknamed the Wolfpack. They participate in the [[National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics|NAIA]]'s [[Gulf Coast Athletic Conference]]. Loyola's six intercollegiate teams are almost wholly funded through student activity fees per a student referendum passed in 1991. In 1972, Loyola suspended its athletics program, citing "educational and financial" reasons.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://media.www.loyolamaroon.com/media/storage/paper542/news/2002/02/01/WebExtra/Looking.Back.The.Day.The.Wolfpack.Died-173975.shtml| title=Looking Back: The day the Wolfpack died|year=2002|accessdate=2008-07-23}}</ref> However, in 1991, the athletics program was reinstituted, amid student appeals for its reinstatement, including the aforementioned referendum. Since 2003, the athletic department has offered three athletic scholarships in [[basketball]] to attract talent. Locally, Loyola's biggest rival is the adjacent [[Tulane University]], and the annual basketball game between the two teams is one of biggest athletic events at Loyola. [[Spring Hill College]] is also another rival in conference play. The Pack Pride Committee was founded in 2007 to promote athletics and to encourage community members to be "Proud to be Part of the 'Pack'".
Loyola's sports teams are nicknamed the Wolfpack. They participate in the [[National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics|NAIA]]'s [[Gulf Coast Athletic Conference]]. Loyola's six intercollegiate teams are almost wholly funded through student activity fees per a student referendum passed in 1991. In 1972, Loyola suspended its athletics program, citing "educational and financial" reasons.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://media.www.loyolamaroon.com/media/storage/paper542/news/2002/02/01/WebExtra/Looking.Back.The.Day.The.Wolfpack.Died-173975.shtml| title=Looking Back: The day the Wolfpack died|year=2002|accessdate=2008-07-23}}</ref> However, in 1991, the athletics program was reinstituted, amid student appeals for its reinstatement, including the aforementioned referendum. Since 2003, the athletic department has offered three athletic scholarships in [[basketball]] to attract talent. Locally, Loyola's biggest rival is the adjacent [[Tulane University]], and the annual basketball game between the two teams is one of biggest athletic events at Loyola. [[Spring Hill College]] is also another rival in conference play. The Pack Pride Committee was founded in 2007 to promote athletics and to encourage community members to be "Proud to be Part of the 'Pack'".
